subcategory: Activity | My Wife Does Not Work | 35-40 Min

content.heading: Training Scenario: Understanding Homemaking as Work

content.text: To recognize and appreciate the diverse range of tasks and responsibilities managed by homemakers, often unnoticed or undervalued in our society.
To highlight the importance of recognizing and valuing all forms of work, whether paid or unpaid.
To encourage participants to acknowledge and support the homemakers in their lives.
To change participantsâ€™ perception of homemaking/housework through this exercise.
A printout or digital copy of the provided image, showing the homemaker's daily schedule.
Pen and paper for note-taking.
This activity involves the following steps:
Observation
Participants will study the image quietly for a few minutes. They will note the various activities they see the homemaker perform at different times of the day.
Group Discussion
Then, participants will share their observations on the following questions:
What tasks do you see being performed?
How might these tasks contribute to the functioning of a household
What skills are required to perform these tasks effectively?
Throughout her day, whom does this woman care for?
How can we ensure that every member of society acknowledges the efforts of others, including those of women?
Role Analysis
Then, participants will be asked to list all the roles the homemaker takes on throughout the day (e.g., cook, caregiver, cleaner, shopper, etc.).
Time Managment
In this step, participants will discuss time management and multitasking skills depicted in the image, comparing them to those required in a corporate job.
Value

Assignment: Moreover, participants will estimate how much each task would cost if outsourced (e.g., hiring a nanny, professional cleaning services, etc.). Hence, this activity is expected to lead to a discussion about the economic value of homemaking.
Empathy Exercise
Finally, participants will be asked to imagine themselves performing each task for a week, and to share how they would feel and what challenges they might encounter.
